segment.source: How to Manage Virtual Applications Manually
segment.target: How to Manage Virtual Applications Manually

segment.source: How to Manage Virtual Applications Manually
segment.target: How to Manage Virtual Applications Manually

segment.source: How to Manage Virtual Applications Manually
segment.target: How to Manage Virtual Applications Manually

segment.source: You can use the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client Management Console to manage virtual applications in the App-V Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).
segment.target: You can use the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client Management Console to manage virtual applications in the App-V Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).

segment.source: App-V administrators can use perform the following tasks:
segment.target: App-V administrators can use perform the following tasks:

segment.source: How to Load or Unload an App-V Application
segment.target: How to Load or Unload an App-V Application

segment.source: You can use the following procedures to load or unload an application from the cache, directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedures to load or unload an application from the cache, directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of applications.
segment.target: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of applications.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you load or unload a package, all the applications in the package are loaded into or removed from cache.
segment.target: When you load or unload a package, all the applications in the package are loaded into or removed from cache.

segment.source: When loading a package, if you do not have adequate space in cache to load the applications, increase your cache size.
segment.target: When loading a package, if you do not have adequate space in cache to load the applications, increase your cache size.

segment.source: For more information about cache size, see How to Change the Cache Size and the Drive Letter Designation.
segment.target: For more information about cache size, see How to Change the Cache Size and the Drive Letter Designation.

segment.source: To load an App-V application
segment.target: To load an App-V application

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Load from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Load from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: The application is automatically loaded.
segment.target: The application is automatically loaded.

segment.source: The progress is tracked in the column labeled Package Status.
segment.target: The progress is tracked in the column labeled Package Status.

segment.source: You must refresh the view to see that the load is complete or to see the progress.
segment.target: You must refresh the view to see that the load is complete or to see the progress.

segment.source: To unload an App-V application
segment.target: To unload an App-V application

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Unload from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Unload from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: The application is automatically unloaded, and the Package Status column is updated to reflect the change.
segment.target: The application is automatically unloaded, and the Package Status column is updated to reflect the change.

segment.source: How to clear an App-V application
segment.target: How to clear an App-V application

segment.source: You can clear an application from the console directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can clear an application from the console directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: When you clear an application, the system removes the settings, shortcuts, and file type associations that correspond to the application and also removes the application from the user’s list of applications.
segment.target: When you clear an application, the system removes the settings, shortcuts, and file type associations that correspond to the application and also removes the application from the user’s list of applications.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you clear an application from the console, you can no longer use that application.
segment.target: When you clear an application from the console, you can no longer use that application.

segment.source: However, the application remains in cache and is still available to other users on the same system.
segment.target: However, the application remains in cache and is still available to other users on the same system.

segment.source: After a publishing refresh, the cleared applications will again become available to you.
segment.target: After a publishing refresh, the cleared applications will again become available to you.

segment.source: If there are multiple applications in a package, the user's settings are not removed until all of the applications are cleared.
segment.target: If there are multiple applications in a package, the user's settings are not removed until all of the applications are cleared.

segment.source: To clear an application from the console
segment.target: To clear an application from the console

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Clear from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Clear from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: At the confirmation prompt, click Yes to remove the application or click No to cancel the operation.
segment.target: At the confirmation prompt, click Yes to remove the application or click No to cancel the operation.

segment.source: How to Repair an App-V application
segment.target: How to Repair an App-V application

segment.source: To repair a selected application, you can perform the following procedure directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: To repair a selected application, you can perform the following procedure directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: When you repair an application, you remove any custom user settings and restore the default settings.
segment.target: When you repair an application, you remove any custom user settings and restore the default settings.

segment.source: This action does not change or delete shortcuts or file type associations, and it does not remove the application from cache.
segment.target: This action does not change or delete shortcuts or file type associations, and it does not remove the application from cache.

segment.source: To repair an App-V application
segment.target: To repair an App-V application

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane.

segment.source: Right-click the desired application, and select Repair from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Right-click the desired application, and select Repair from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: At the confirmation prompt, click Yes to repair the application or No to cancel.
segment.target: At the confirmation prompt, click Yes to repair the application or No to cancel.

segment.source: How to import an App-V application
segment.target: How to import an App-V application

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to import an application into the cache directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to import an application into the cache directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: To import an App-V application
segment.target: To import an App-V application

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Import from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Import from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: From the Browse window, navigate to the location of the package file for the desired application, and then click OK.
segment.target: From the Browse window, navigate to the location of the package file for the desired application, and then click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you have already configured an import search path or if the SFT file is in the same path as the last successful import, step 2 is not required.
segment.target: If you have already configured an import search path or if the SFT file is in the same path as the last successful import, step 2 is not required.

segment.source: How to lock or unlock an App-V application
segment.target: How to lock or unlock an App-V application

segment.source: You can use the following procedures to lock or unlock any application in the Application Virtualization Desktop Client cache or the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) cache.
segment.target: You can use the following procedures to lock or unlock any application in the Application Virtualization Desktop Client cache or the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) cache.

segment.source: A locked application cannot be removed from the cache to make room for new applications.
segment.target: A locked application cannot be removed from the cache to make room for new applications.

segment.source: To remove a locked application from the Application Virtualization Desktop Client cache or the Client for Remote Desktop Services cache, you must first unlock it.
segment.target: To remove a locked application from the Application Virtualization Desktop Client cache or the Client for Remote Desktop Services cache, you must first unlock it.

segment.source: To lock an application
segment.target: To lock an application

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane.

segment.source: Right-click the desired application, and select Lock from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Right-click the desired application, and select Lock from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: The selected application is locked in the cache.
segment.target: The selected application is locked in the cache.

segment.source: To unlock an application
segment.target: To unlock an application

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane.

segment.source: Right-click the desired application, and select Unlock from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Right-click the desired application, and select Unlock from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: The selected application is unlocked in the cache and can be removed.
segment.target: The selected application is unlocked in the cache and can be removed.

segment.source: How to delete an App-V application
segment.target: How to delete an App-V application

segment.source: When you select the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console, the Results pane displays a list of applications.
segment.target: When you select the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console, the Results pane displays a list of applications.

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to delete an application from the Results pane, which also removes the application from the cache.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to delete an application from the Results pane, which also removes the application from the cache.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you delete an application, the selected application will no longer be available to any users on that client.
segment.target: When you delete an application, the selected application will no longer be available to any users on that client.

segment.source: Shortcuts and file type associations are hidden, and the application is deleted from cache.
segment.target: Shortcuts and file type associations are hidden, and the application is deleted from cache.

segment.source: However, if another application refers to data in the file system cache data for the selected application, these items will not be deleted.
segment.target: However, if another application refers to data in the file system cache data for the selected application, these items will not be deleted.

segment.source: After a publishing refresh, the deleted applications will again become available to you.
segment.target: After a publishing refresh, the deleted applications will again become available to you.

segment.source: To delete an application
segment.target: To delete an application

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Delete from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select Delete from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: At the confirmation prompt, click Yes to remove the application or click No to cancel the operation.
segment.target: At the confirmation prompt, click Yes to remove the application or click No to cancel the operation.

segment.source: How to change an App-V application icon
segment.target: How to change an App-V application icon

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to change an icon associated with the selected application directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to change an icon associated with the selected application directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: To change an application icon
segment.target: To change an application icon

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane, and right-click the desired application.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane, and right-click the desired application.

segment.source: Select Properties.
segment.target: Select Properties.

segment.source: On the General tab, click Change Icon.
segment.target: On the General tab, click Change Icon.

segment.source: Select the desired icon, or browse to another location to select the icon.
segment.target: Select the desired icon, or browse to another location to select the icon.

segment.source: After you've selected the icon, click OK.
segment.target: After you've selected the icon, click OK.

segment.source: The new icon appears in the Results pane.
segment.target: The new icon appears in the Results pane.

segment.source: How to add an App-V application
segment.target: How to add an App-V application

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to add an application directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to add an application directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: To add an application
segment.target: To add an application

segment.source: In the Results pane, right-click and select New Application from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: In the Results pane, right-click and select New Application from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: On the wizard page, you can perform the following tasks:
segment.target: On the wizard page, you can perform the following tasks:

segment.source: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.
segment.target: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.

segment.source: Browse to and select the desired icon.
segment.target: Browse to and select the desired icon.

segment.source: OSD File Path or URL—Enter a local absolute path, a full UNC path (shared file or directory on a network), or an HTTP URL.
segment.target: OSD File Path or URL—Enter a local absolute path, a full UNC path (shared file or directory on a network), or an HTTP URL.

segment.source: (OSD browse button)—Displays the standard Windows Open File dialog box.
segment.target: (OSD browse button)—Displays the standard Windows Open File dialog box.

segment.source: Browse to find the desired file.
segment.target: Browse to find the desired file.

segment.source: Click Finish to add the application to the Results pane.
segment.target: Click Finish to add the application to the Results pane.

segment.source: How to publish an App-V application shortcut
segment.target: How to publish an App-V application shortcut

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to publish shortcuts to an application directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to publish shortcuts to an application directly from the Results pane of the Application node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: To publish application shortcuts
segment.target: To publish application shortcuts

segment.source: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select New Shortcut from the pop-up menu to display the New Shortcut Wizard.
segment.target: Move the cursor to the Results pane, right-click the desired application, and select New Shortcut from the pop-up menu to display the New Shortcut Wizard.

segment.source: On the first page of the New Shortcut Wizard, select an icon and specify a name for the shortcut.
segment.target: On the first page of the New Shortcut Wizard, select an icon and specify a name for the shortcut.

segment.source: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.
segment.target: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.

segment.source: Browse to and select the desired icon.
segment.target: Browse to and select the desired icon.

segment.source: Shortcut Title—Enter the name you want to give the shortcut.
segment.target: Shortcut Title—Enter the name you want to give the shortcut.

segment.source: This field defaults to the existing name and version of the application.
segment.target: This field defaults to the existing name and version of the application.

segment.source: On the second page of the wizard, determine the location of the published shortcut.
segment.target: On the second page of the wizard, determine the location of the published shortcut.

segment.source: The Desktop—Select this check box to publish the shortcut to the desktop.
segment.target: The Desktop—Select this check box to publish the shortcut to the desktop.

segment.source: The Quick Launch Toolbar—Select this check box to publish the shortcut to the Quick Launch toolbar.
segment.target: The Quick Launch Toolbar—Select this check box to publish the shortcut to the Quick Launch toolbar.

segment.source: The Send To Menu—Select this check box to publish the shortcut to the Send To menu.
segment.target: The Send To Menu—Select this check box to publish the shortcut to the Send To menu.

segment.source: Programs in the Start Menu—When you select the Start Menu check box, this field becomes active.
segment.target: Programs in the Start Menu—When you select the Start Menu check box, this field becomes active.

segment.source: Leave this field blank to publish the shortcut directly to the root of the Programs folder, or enter a folder name or hierarchy—for example, "MyComputerOffice Applications."
segment.target: Leave this field blank to publish the shortcut directly to the root of the Programs folder, or enter a folder name or hierarchy—for example, "MyComputerOffice Applications."

segment.source: Shortcuts created this way are available only for the current user.
segment.target: Shortcuts created this way are available only for the current user.

segment.source: Another location and Browse button—When you select the Another location check box, this field becomes active.
segment.target: Another location and Browse button—When you select the Another location check box, this field becomes active.

segment.source: Enter any valid location on the computer or any available UNC path (shared file or directory on a network).
segment.target: Enter any valid location on the computer or any available UNC path (shared file or directory on a network).

segment.source: The Browse button displays a standard Windows File Open dialog box.
segment.target: The Browse button displays a standard Windows File Open dialog box.

segment.source: On the third page of the wizard, enter desired command-line parameters.
segment.target: On the third page of the wizard, enter desired command-line parameters.

segment.source: Click Finish to publish the shortcuts and exit to the Results pane.
segment.target: Click Finish to publish the shortcuts and exit to the Results pane.

segment.source: How to add a file type association for an App-V application
segment.target: How to add a file type association for an App-V application

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to add a file type association, using the File Type Associations node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to add a file type association, using the File Type Associations node in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: To add a file type association
segment.target: To add a file type association

segment.source: Right-click the File Type Associations node, and select New Association from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Right-click the File Type Associations node, and select New Association from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: Complete the first step of the dialog box by completing the following information, and then click Next:
segment.target: Complete the first step of the dialog box by completing the following information, and then click Next:

segment.source: Extension—Enter a new file name extension.
segment.target: Extension—Enter a new file name extension.

segment.source: This field is blank by default.
segment.target: This field is blank by default.

segment.source: Create a new file type with this description—Select this radio button to enter a new file type description in the active field.
segment.target: Create a new file type with this description—Select this radio button to enter a new file type description in the active field.

segment.source: This button is selected by default, and the active field is blank.
segment.target: This button is selected by default, and the active field is blank.

segment.source: Apply this file type to all users—Select this check box when you want this association to be global for all users.
segment.target: Apply this file type to all users—Select this check box when you want this association to be global for all users.

segment.source: By default, this box is cleared.
segment.target: By default, this box is cleared.

segment.source: Link this extension with an existing file type—Select this radio button to associate the extension with an existing file type.
segment.target: Link this extension with an existing file type—Select this radio button to associate the extension with an existing file type.

segment.source: Pick a file type from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Pick a file type from the drop-down list.

segment.source: When you choose this option, Next is changed to Finish.
segment.target: When you choose this option, Next is changed to Finish.

segment.source: Complete the second step of the dialog box by completing the following information, and then click Finish to return to the Client Management Console:
segment.target: Complete the second step of the dialog box by completing the following information, and then click Finish to return to the Client Management Console:

segment.source: Change Icon—Click this button to change the application icon.
segment.target: Change Icon—Click this button to change the application icon.

segment.source: Select one of the available icons, or browse to a new location and select an icon.
segment.target: Select one of the available icons, or browse to a new location and select an icon.

segment.source: Open files with the selected application—Select this radio button to open the file with an existing application.
segment.target: Open files with the selected application—Select this radio button to open the file with an existing application.

segment.source: Choose an application from the drop-down list of available applications.
segment.target: Choose an application from the drop-down list of available applications.

segment.source: Open file with the association described in this OSD file—Select this radio button to specify an Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file that determines the application used to open the file.
segment.target: Open file with the association described in this OSD file—Select this radio button to specify an Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file that determines the application used to open the file.

segment.source: Use the browse button to select an existing location, or enter a path or HTTP-formatted URL in this field.
segment.target: Use the browse button to select an existing location, or enter a path or HTTP-formatted URL in this field.

segment.source: How to delete a file type association for an App-V application
segment.target: How to delete a file type association for an App-V application

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to delete a file type association.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to delete a file type association.

segment.source: The File Type Associations node is one level below the Application Virtualization node in the Scope pane.
segment.target: The File Type Associations node is one level below the Application Virtualization node in the Scope pane.

segment.source: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of file type associations.
segment.target: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of file type associations.

segment.source: To remove a file type association
segment.target: To remove a file type association

segment.source: In the Results pane, right-click the extension of the file type association you want to delete.
segment.target: In the Results pane, right-click the extension of the file type association you want to delete.

segment.source: Select Delete from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Select Delete from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: Click Yes to delete the association, or click No to return to the Results pane.
segment.target: Click Yes to delete the association, or click No to return to the Results pane.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Application Virtualization Client
segment.target: Application Virtualization Client
